news.article_text:
This article first appeared on GuruFocus.

PDD Holdings (NASDAQ:PDD), owner of Temu, slid nearly 1.5% on Wednesday after its third-quarter results beat EPS estimates but fell short on revenue.

For the three months ended Sept., adjusted EPS rose to $2.97 from $2.62 a year earlier, topping the $2.33 analysts expected. Revenue reached $15.23 billion, up 7% from $14.27 billion a year earlier but below Wall Street's $15.38 billion forecast.

news.headline: These Chinese Tech Stocks Crushed Q3 EPS Expectations
news.summary: Chinese tech stocks are making the case for more upside after crushing Q3 earnings expectations. Baidu BIDU posted much stronger Q3 results than expected by offsetting weakness in traditional advertising. Trip.com TCOM rounds out the list after obliterating Q3 EPS expectations of $
news.article_text:
As the market awaits Nvidia’s NVDA much-anticipated Q3 report, impressive quarterly results from several Chinese tech firms have been a highlight of this week’s earnings lineup so far.

Before the latest trade tensions between the U.S. and China, which have been partly alleviated, Chinese equities had surged to multi-year highs. While profit-taking and macro pressures have led to a correction, these Chinese tech stocks are making the case for more upside after crushing Q3 earnings expectations.

news.headline: Bernstein downgrades PDD, says it needs to ’start doing grown-up company things’
news.summary: Bernstein cut its rating on Temu parent PDD Holdings to Market-Perform from Outperform. Analyst Robin Zhu said PDD now needs to “start doing grown-up company things’
news.article_text:
Investing.com -- Bernstein on Wednesday cut its rating on Temu parent PDD Holdings to Market-Perform from Outperform, arguing the company’s domestic business is maturing, demanding clearer communication with investors and more disciplined capital allocation.

news.headline: Global tech shares surge as Nvidia's AI boom powers market rally
news.summary: Chip bellwether Nvidia's stellar results tempered some concerns over a potential AI bubble. Shares of U.S. chipmakers Advanced Micro Devices and Intel rose about 4.3% and nearly 2%, respectively.
news.article_text:
By Rashika Singh and Rae Wee

(Reuters) -Global technology shares rallied on Thursday after Nvidia's blow-out quarterly results signaled that demand for artificial intelligence hardware remains strong even as concerns of the historic boom outpacing fundamentals linger.

Semiconductor-related stocks have taken the brunt of the pullback in correlation with AI bubble fears, and Entegris ENTG has been one to avoid in particular.
